name: BEST WESTERN PLUS Madison Spa Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned home from a 2 night stay on the 25-26 march and we were extremely happy with the courteous and very friendly staff. The deluxe room was great with the spa well equipped and had everything that was needed plus more. Breakfast was great and we would be happy to stay there again. The dinner at the restaurant was a delight best we have had for a long time well done waiting staff on this night you were run of your feet with a full Restaurant I have to get on the phone and book again
reviews.title: Best stay we have had ad a local resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The resturant is excellent, the meal delicious,breakfast equal to good 4star services at equal accomodation.
reviews.title: Luxury and Elegance

reviews.text: The spa in the bath house was rank. It had a film of greasy stuff on the surface. I also think it was meant to be salt water but they might put chlorine in it because its probably cheaper for them to maintain that way as it seemed like a chlorine and salt smell. Totally disgusting after getting out we all had spots come up on our faces and bodies that lasted for several hours. We didnt realise it was from the spa until the second time we got the rashes after getting in the second time. The shower in the room obviously once had a screen but no longer, you could see where it once was but they now have it gone so water gets all over the tiles where the toilet is. Also when paying to stay somewhere you expect to be able to use the pool, bar etc but we werent allowed to because they closed it off for their own personal use. If we had of been warned we would have stayed elsewhere. The room did have a lovely gas log fire and the bed was comfy and so were the views, the spa was nice but whenn paying for a spa room its not pleasant to have the hours you are allowed to use it be dictated to you. Also pretty sure they use generic shampoo soap etc in dispensers rather than giving guests little bottles where they can see the brand used. I thought resorts had gyms too but this does not have a gym. Also a bbq would have been nice of there was one to use. And they have the worst coffee ever. We are from Melbourne where there is a sophisticated coffee culture, the stuff they passed as coffee was awful so i would recommend taking your own and a plunger and your own cutlery because there is only tea spoons in the rooms, we ordered pasta from the pizza shop one night and we had to eat it with tea spoons because they closed reception at 4pm and we forgot to ask the pizza place to include a plastic fork for us
reviews.title: They have a spa I reckon you could get pregnant in just from sitting in the water!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also booked the Spreets 2 night accommodation package and after reading other reviews on this site we didn't go there with too many expectations. We were given an upstairs room which was clean, quite modern and had a large 2 person spa in the corner looking out the window to the bushland. We didn't use the communal spa or plunge pool as we found the spa in our room more than adequate. The outdoor pool was a little too cold, so we didn't swim in that either. Our breakfast was lovely both mornings. We didn't use the $40 vouchers as these are 'to put toward' a treatment and we still would've had to pay something. (We weren't offered them at check in anyway) We didn't hear the traffic on the main road. The staff were polite and overall I'd say we had a very pleasant stay and it was a good place to base ourselves when exploring Echuca/Moama. I'm not quite sure where the supposed $800 value was, but overall it was a good experience.
reviews.title: A very pleasant stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I wanted a quiet break in a pleasant location to get away from a very hectic lifestyle. We were able to take advantage of a package deal which in our opinion was good value for money. Our room was a deluxe spa room. Before booking we checked the website, which as it turned out did not make any promises that were not kept. The location is a busy highway, however we were not aware of traffic noise once in the room. It was on the first floor and looked out on tranquil bushland. The in-room double spa was located by a large picture window and made for a very relaxing experience. The fireplace in the room created a cosy atmosphere. I had looked up the trip advisor reviews and was a little concerned at what we might find, however we were not disappointed. The room was in good repair and had good decor. It wasn't fancy but overall well appointed, spacious, clean, modern and comfortable. The staff were uniformly pleasant and helpful, from reception, to restaurant to housekeeping. We took advantage of a number of the day spa treatments. The vichy package was definitely the best - exfoliation and massage while being sprayed with the most relaxing flow of water - that was a new experience for me. My average rating below for service (3) arises from the fact that I attempted to make a booking for the day spa a week beforehand (as requested on the website) - I left a message for someone to call me back to discuss the different types of services. No-one did, and because of my hectic schedule I made the booking only once I arrived. Because they were nearly fully booked, I ended up only getting about half of the treatments I had planned on. The restaurant has a very good set menu deal which gave a good selection of tasty items and good value for money. Overall the trip met our objectives which was to have a relaxing time in a pleasant location, and we would definitely recommend it. We are both seasoned travellers and fairly picky. We consider this to be good value for money and a location that delivers what it promises.
reviews.title: Pleasant break away from the rat race

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was more of a motel than a resort. The room was very spacious and the double spa was huge. Was a bit dissappointed by the 'resort' facilities. The spa was closed for maintenance and the heated plunge pool was nothing more than an oversized bath tub. I did not see any sauna or steam rooms and their was no gym. In summer the outside pool would ahve ben nice. For the price we paid I would of expected cable TV as well.
reviews.title: No resort facilities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We brought this $299 - 2 nights "Escape to Spa Resort in Moama" special promotion through Spreets which is said to be worth $800!
reviews.title: It is a MOTEL, NOT a RESORT as Promoted in Spreets promotion!

reviews.text: First up, I didn't stay overnight at this spa, I was just a day visitor to use the spa treatments so I can't comment on the rooms. I booked at short notice so they could only find enough time to fit me in for a short massage, which is fair enough without much notice.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the day spa somewhat

reviews.text: I think the pool and bath house have 'good bones' as they say, but it's now time to spruce the place up with a paint job and sundry maintenance.
reviews.title: Save your money and go elsewhere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I enjoyed a dip in the pool, which is small but attractive, and then tested the spa pool, which was ok but not amazing.
reviews.title: Disappointing
Fantastic bush views, spacious rooms; however the words "spa resort" promise more than they deliver
reviews.text: I had a most enjoyable 30 minute massage in a pleasant treatment room; the masseuse was a nice young woman but she possesses that irritating habit of the quite young of speaking so rapidly all the words blend into one incomprehensible sound. Grrrr.
The treatment service I had was very nice indeed but overpriced.
reviews.title: Great long weekend with the family!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for the long weekend. The rooms have a view over bushland at the back of the motel. Liked the rooms as they were clean and quiet, except when the guest in the neighbouring room decided to take a spa bath late at night and early in the morning. As named, this is a motel with an attached day spa, but their prices are quite high for a motel. Every item in the room has a price tag attached (including wine bottle stand, bottle opener and bath bomb), the shampoo and soap is in a dispenser attached to the wall.
reviews.title: Very nice motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The motel is a 30 minute walk to the centre of Echuca.
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.text: Stayed here recently for one night with my husband in a ground floor room. The room was spacious, there's a spa bath in the room, and a nice view of the bushland outside the large window. However the room feels very much like a motel room, and the decor is looking a little tired. The bed wasn't comfortable at all. No Foxtel, which is what we expect from paying the sort of prices here. We used the communal spa and sauna which were ok. It was nice to sit by the pool with a mid-afternoon snack (bruschetta) and also have breakfast out there too. Overall, a pleasant stay in an overpriced resort-like motel, nothing to rave on about, but nothing seriously worth complaining about.
reviews.title: Friendly and relaxing place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff are great, friendly and helpful. They sincerly seem happy and very approachable. . And the food is amazing.
reviews.title: 2 Nights at Madison Spa

reviews.text: We bought 2 nights at the resort in Moama with a Spreets voucher. It was a good deal and included Massage and facial vouchers, basic continental breakfast each day, and a bottle of bubbly on arrival.
reviews.title: Sensational
